title: On Kemeny's Constant for Markov Processes
summary: This paper presents a new approach to Kemeny's constant for irreducible Markov chains on a finite state space, based on time reversal and a mean occupation time formula. It extends the result to continuous-time Markov processes, showing that the constancy holds almost surely with respect to the stationary distribution.
usefulness_reason: The paper directly discusses "continuous-time Markov processes", which are a fundamental type of point process. This aligns with the "Point Process" aspect of the query. While it doesn't explicitly mention spatio-temporal aspects or specific datasets, its core topic is highly relevant to the underlying mathematical framework of point processes.
